basics.name: John Gabriel Martinez
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am currently pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, while developing my technical skills through structured learning and project-based work. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2027.

education.institution: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
courses: Security and Trust I: Resource Protections (ICS 355)

work.summary: Customer service and team-based food service operations
highlights: Worked in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
Handled customer orders and transactions accurately
Maintained cleanliness and followed safety procedures

volunteer.summary: Participated in community clean-up activities through the Adopt-A-Highway program.
highlights: Assisted with roadside clean-up and maintenance efforts
Worked collaboratively with group members on community service initiatives

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognized for achieving a semester GPA of 3.5 or higher while completing a full academic course load.

awards.title: Mānoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Merit-based scholarship awarded to first-year students based on academic strength and holistic review at admission, intended to support undegraduate study toward degree completion.

awards.title: Hawaiʻi B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: State-supported scholarship awarded to eligible undergraduate students based on academic achievement and ongoing enrollment and academic progress.
